main event: On January 11, 1948, two US Air Force Captains observed an unidentified flying object (UFO) over Hartford, Connecticut. The object appeared to be disc-shaped with a bluish center and red edges, traveling at a high velocity before dropping out of sight near Mt. Tom.
interesting points: The UFO was observed by credible witnesses, two US Air Force Captains - Kenneth N. Barton and James F. Zegler.
The object was described as having a bluish center, red edges, and was disc-shaped, resembling a shooting star.
It had a very high velocity and made no sound, leaving no trails behind.
The sighting took place at 1630 hours, and the UFO dropped out of sight near Mt. Tom, Massachusetts.
The document contains references to the declassification and downgrading of information at specific intervals.
sighted object: disc-shaped UFO with bluish center and red edges
photographs: no photographs included in the report
